page.title: 16Local History of Beeley Moor
page.content: The area has not seen many changes since it was surveyed for the publication of the first edition of the one-inch Ordnance survey map of England and Wales in 1840. One of the earliest references to Beeley was made in 1086 when the name was said to mean Bega's clearing and it still remains an area devoid of much habitation and in its natural state. In the north west corner of the area, there is evidence of an old field system. In 1832, the Beeley Enclosure Award came into being, the prime objective aimed at bringing about agricultural improvements. The Duke of Devonshire was allocated a substantial acreage and further additions have been made over the years. It is now designated Chatsworth Estate land.
